column5: Anyone else going to see The Who tonight in the Hammer  CANT WAIT bouncing of the walls  Peter
Big Who fan here Peter, but ever since Entwistle passed away, I just cringe when I see them... that and Daultry's voice make it a no go for me. That said, I would love to hear Quad again... HH

Joe I do agree with you but to see these guys rip it up for what could be the last go around i cant pass it by they got a good back ground their doing quad and really what kind of Who fan would i be if i didnt go truly one of the last of the greats check out 515 in montreal on you tube yeah no ox and rogers pipes arent what they used to be but hell im a WHO fan through and through  Long Live Rock

Well... Peter....have all the FUN you are legally allowed--and then some... Bronte  Never seen that outfit LIVE personally---but i admire their musicianship  Sure as 'Heck' will be better than that Bon Jovi thang last night---Entertainers Dude--not musicians JMO   Sheesh--relax peeps  Smile will yah !  Thanks  Paul

Yep I will be there with ya Peter.....We have floor tickets so my body (and ears) will be shot tomorrow.....   Agree about the whole Entwistle thang Joe but I'm a die hard to the bitter end....  Peter PM me if you want to meet somewhere to say Hi..

Pino is a great player, don't get me wrong, but as a bass player myself, The Ox was someone who inspired me. I was fortunate enough to have seen them 4 times, none unfortunately with Moon. Have a great time fellas, John ear plugs should be in order! Can you see the Real Me, can yah! HH
And here yah go...  HH

Hey Joe .. I remember hitching a ride to Montreal from To, we used to go to the Mac truck yard and get a ride from there .That night  the driver was a hugh Who fan , still to this day all i remember is the GREAT bass lines, songs what ever, but the BASS never heard the likes of that.. Been a who fan since ..  P.S.Joe,  It's my sons 18th birthday this Sun. , you know Im a crazy gear guy , From a friend of a friend  , I found him a ebmm van halen , $3600..00  ,Lots of money for a 18 year old  But if ya been reading in the news lately , sad so so sad ,Kids that play guitars , fish , hunt , have a hobby ,have a relationship with their family , DO NOT KILL EACH OTHER ..

Agree with HH a great band in they re time.  Saw them 25-30 yrs ago in Buffalo and at the EX (I think that was the show when openning act Joe Jackson's backup singer got hit in the face with a hotdog and he told the crowd to take a hike).  Both great shows and it was alot of fun camping out for tickets at lamport stadium (had to do that in the old days before the internet).
I saw them way back in 1973 or '74 at the Gardens in Toronto. Keith Moon was wearing a Toronto Maple Leaf hocky sweater.
So boys, how was the show? Any pics that you would care to share? HH
Simply awesome........great great show one of the best I have seen....Amazing trib's to Moon and Entwistle..
Will try and get some vid up tonight..
Thanks for the pic John and looking forward to the video! Kinda funny how a four piece band now needs multiple instrumentalists to pull off their material. HH
Keyboards and brass Joe, the brass was in tribute to John E...and as you know, Townshend's brother was added just before Entwistle's death and Pino of course just after...

Quad was never really doable on stage when it came out it was very complex and needed much back tracks and machines on stage for the four what was witnessed last night is what pete envisioned it to be and yep that has to be the best who show i ever saw very fat very visual and the guys were just a plowing great great great show well worth every cent and it may turn out to be the last go around  an opus maybe  Peter
I was really impressed with Zak Starkey on drums during the New York fund raiser on tv... the guy was an animal! HH
Hey, maybe they'll do a "fare well" concert in Toronto to close out the tour?!!! LOL HH
There was talk about doing another TO concert..
A friend who was at the show passed these pics along.  He said Daltry's voice is not what it used to be but Townsend was as good as ever.
Good clear photos,would of loved to see them again.
I saw their "final tour" in 1980.  They headlined at the Ex, I think it was also J. Geils, Heart and Nash the Slash.  Kenny Jones was the drummer at that time.
